assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: TrioCanu v. 1.8; purge_dups v. 1.0.0; Scaff 10x v. 4.1.0; Bionano solve v. 3.2.1_04122018; Salsa2 HiC v. 2.2; Arrow polishing and gap filling v. smrtlink_6.0.0.47841; Freebayes 1.3.1 v. 1.3.1; VGP trio assembly pipeline v. 1.6

bioprojects.title: Tursiops truncatus (bottlenose dolphin) genome, mTurTru1, paternal haplotype

attributes.name: collected_by
attributes.value: Leigh Clayton, Jill Arnold, Winston Timp, Norah Hilger

biosample.collectedBy: Leigh Clayton, Jill Arnold, Winston Timp, Norah Hilger

description.comment: The bottlenose dolphin is the most common species of the family Delphinidae, and one of the best studied vocal learning mammals. This sample was collected as part of family trio of bottlenose dolphins. This sample is from a deceased male calf also from the National Aquarium Child. The parents are an adult female housed at the National Aquarium, an adult male housed at Gulf World. This trio is currently being used to generate chromosomal level reference assembly as part of the G10K-VGP Project.
description.title: Animal sample from Tursiops truncatus

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: Bottlenose dolphin child tissue for G10K-VGP trio reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments: This assembly represents the paternal haplotype of the diploid genome Tursiops truncatus. The trio assembly merged haplotype data are in WGS project JAAOMD000000000. The maternal haplotype sequences are in WGS project JAAOMB000000000
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I CLR; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
